title: showWaveAnnouncement() is never called - wave banners never appear
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-byx.14: The showWaveAnnouncement() method was implemented in HUD.ts but is never called. BattleScene.advanceWave() calls hud.updateWave() but not hud.showWaveAnnouncement(). Additionally, wave 1 starts in create() but no announcement is shown. The acceptance criteria 'Wave 2 starts, Wave 2 appears center screen' cannot be satisfied.

title: Jingles (victory/defeat) respond to SFX volume instead of music volume
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-50y.6: Victory/defeat jingles are set with loop: false, but setMusicVolume() only updates looped sounds while setSfxVolume() updates non-looped sounds. This means jingles respond to SFX volume slider instead of music volume slider, which is inconsistent with user expectation since they are conceptually music.

title: Pending sounds bypass audio pooling on unlock
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-50y: When audio is locked (browser autoplay policy), playSfx() queues sounds to pendingSounds[]. On unlock, playPendingSounds() plays them directly via this.scene.sound.play() without going through the pool limiting logic. If many sword_hit sounds were queued, they would all play simultaneously when unlocked, bypassing the maxInstances limit and causing audio chaos.

title: GameState.getInstance() and init() store plain data but cast as class - methods will crash at runtime
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-e7m.11: The GameState class has init() and getInstance() methods that are broken. init() at line 163 stores state.data (plain object) to registry but returns a GameState class instance. getInstance() at line 148 casts the registry value (plain object) as GameState class. When code follows the documented pattern 'GameState.getInstance(this).save()' (CODEMAP_CORE.md:330), it will crash because calling .save() on a plain object fails. Currently latent (save() not called anywhere) but blocks future save functionality.

title: notifyEnemySpawn() is never called - boss spawn sound never plays
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-50y.15: WaveManager.notifyEnemySpawn() was added for UC-AUDIO-12 but is never called anywhere. The method is dead code. Enemy spawning logic needs to call waveManager.notifyEnemySpawn(enemyId) for each enemy, otherwise the acceptance criteria 'Giant spawns in stage 10, hear ominous sound' cannot be met.

title: UpgradeScene.handleUpgradePurchase() overwrites stageStars when saving gameState
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-byx.9: UpgradeScene and LevelSelectScene have incompatible GameState interfaces. When UpgradeScene.handleUpgradePurchase() saves gameState with {highestStage, gold, unitUpgrades}, it overwrites the stageStars field that LevelSelectScene needs. This causes star progress to be lost after purchasing any upgrade.

title: AudioManager stores stale scene reference
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-50y.4: AudioManager stores the initial scene reference (PreloadScene) but is accessed from other scenes. When scenes transition, the stored scene may be destroyed, causing this.scene.sound operations to fail or behave unexpectedly. Should use the game's global sound manager or get scene from the calling context.

title: Keyboard spawn shortcuts bypass cooldown check
description: Found in mini-warriors-reborn-e7m.6: Keyboard input (keys 1-5) in BattleScene.setupSpawnKeyboardInput() only checks if unitId exists, but does NOT check if the unit is on cooldown. Touch input via SpawnBar checks isButtonEnabled() which includes cooldown check, but keyboard skips this. Result: keyboard can spawn units during cooldown, spending gold and restarting cooldown when touch cannot.
